title: Versioning
description: Software versioning is the process of assigning either unique version names or unique version numbers to unique states of computer software.
key-ideas: Typically with versioning, changes in core functions or behavior will not occur in between versions.
Internal versioning - in which a revision number tracks the changes to the code base
External versioning - in which a version number identifies official released software packages
Versioning is often divided into Major and Minor versions, with patches being applied in between.
Semantic Versioning labels versions as Major.Minor.Patch.
Calendar Versioning labels versions with a variation of the date they were released on, such as 2022.10.
Significant changes in the software may be a cause for an organization to change versions.
Organizations that sell software versions as packages, rather than subscriptions, may also use major versions as distinct licensed products.
Major version numbers are sometimes used to group compatible applications and supplicants.
